intro: Etheiranthus milleri var. monstrosus, commonly known as the giant nightshade, is a striking plant native to the island of Saint Helena. It is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and showy, violet-purple flowers that bloom at night. The plant is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
